comments.author: Dave
comments.body: So great having brews w/ Burton Saturday. I could see in an instant that the military life had really changed him. He's much more sinewy now, and I could sense that the things he's seen - the topless bars in Pensacola, the mad runs for more guac at 2 AM, the bladegrass putting greens of the Deep South, the endless, cloying Harvey Wallbangers in the Junior Officer's club - had changed him deeply. He had that wizened, steely look that a man can only acquire in the crucible of combat... or at least from watching a lot of it on NetFlix. I noticed also that MB's long-term red state exposure seems to have permanently twisted his top. When the barkeep at Juanita's asked if he would like a microbrew, he said "No ma'am, I'd like a regular sized one." Yikes...

comments.author: Jennifer
comments.body: "Hey Dave, maybe it shouldn't be called a shortcut until you _know_ it's a shortcut." - from a skinny deer footpath east of Chautauqua Auditorium, JG laments

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: Well now we know, J... it _wasn't_ a shortcut. But how often do you get to see guys living under a bridge? I'm a tad worried about SB's "recon" tomorrow. In SB world that usually means felony trespass. Oh well...

comments.author: Rob
comments.body: Hey folks: Sunshine sounds nice, but I'm joining a group of people training for the MS 150 tomorrow, and need to get a run in today. Anyone care to join me? Meantime, do tell what you find in Sunshine canyon!
